73D044EA881F4BDAB9FB1E5489B02128.description: Develop and/or revise personal and career goals based on the work placement experience.

B37475B3DC15476CBBDE3754DE846141.description: In appreciation prepare a letter, note, card or other communication for the work placement employer

6575F2F449B74CC4B22995AD5A9CB647.description: Update personal career documentation (e.g., resume, portfolio) following the work placement.

D2394F64E3BB4C39BF2E83EA290E4BB1.description: Reflect on the attainment of personal and learning goals.

FD10BE94156E44F3961F9BC0B721218D.description: Showcase one’s skills and abilities demonstrated during the work placement using artifacts, evidence of skill development and personal reflections on aspects of the work experience such as: hours worked; responsibilities and tasks performed; the importance of attitude towards work and taking responsibility for what needs to be done; details about the entry level wage, salary scales and earning potential; worker rights and responsibilities and the role of the union, if applicable; ownership structure (e.g., corporation, franchise, sole proprietorship, partnership); and, • opportunities for advancement at the workplace and elsewhere in the industry.

AAB55B5F290545EC8131C06DA6949E56.description: Relate one’s work placement experience to personal and career goals.

D1E777476F57474D90F13A110C9AE219.description: Document knowledge and awareness of labour standards, safety, workplace ethics, rights and responsibilities, occupational health and safety, and networking observed during the work placement.

1E500B86BD054DA1890526081AAA9F95.description: Document one’s experience using electronic and other tools (e.g., vlogs, blogs, log sheets, reflective journals) to summarize and reflect upon items such as: hours of work including breaks; responsibilities and tasks performed; interactions with the employer, staff, customers and others; company or organization’s ‘raison d’être;’ and, skills developed and demonstrated during the work placement that enhance one’s employability.

2F9DDE25DD414B43938746D8AAF2BCC8.description: Apply relevant skills and abilities during the work placement experience.

6A2071829ED4498FAD4EDAAFAC301573.description: Participate in a work placement experience.

B6CDC99575F64C9D91E10D8DD890544C.description: Reflect upon one’s performance during the interview.

697DA39130CA49ECAB212B7A7B5A9CAC.description: Participate in an interview with the employer prior to beginning the work placement.

65349B2E4ED04D24943286C4A8B3371E.description: Develop a list of questions that could potentially be asked by the employer/work placement in an interview situation as well as answers to the questions.

26F66462EDC04939AF49C8051E663C2C.description: Brainstorm a list of questions to ask the employer before beginning the work placement; these may include: What is my schedule of work hours?, Who is my supervisor?, What should I wear?, When will I be provided with safety training?, What potential hazards might I encounter in the work placement?, Where do I find fire extinguishers, first aid kits and emergency assistance?, What type of safety gear am I expected to wear? Is it provided?, What should I do if I get injured or have an accident in the workplace?, How can I contact my health and safety committee or representative?, Are there any health and safety procedures I should follow?, Who is the first aid person?, Where are safety notices posted?, What should I do in case of a fire or emergency?

9CA8701B74C141C88FD928C838B7F7B3.description: Compile an employer information package that includes documents needed for the work placement (e.g., personal career documentation such as a resume or portfolio, permission forms, logs, self- and employer evaluation forms).

E75D331CC1CA452E9A7C51F362226FC9.description: Develop a procedural guide for the work placement that includes items such as: transportation to and from the work placement; hours of work; guidelines for absence and tardiness; dress code; job description; and, conflict resolution.

2AF3FBAB5D9648E4B14D5E1356B5FF7E.description: In collaboration with all partners, develop personal and learning goals for the work placement.

2B2983342C024DD7A02F6AD1AB058837.description: Research the business/organization to become familiar with its operations.

2DD04BB24B7845D08D24BB1BC28A89C3.description: Explain the roles and responsibilities of each partner (e.g., student, parent, teacher or other school staff, employer) involved in the work placement.

F27421BC7C7346E3BF6135E4F5B6C681.description: Reflect on the effectiveness of the project with respect to the intended purpose.

D86482D0037E4133BE7CF5D374CFF824.description: Engage others outside of the production team in the development or application of the project.

D355F1EE387D4A3D9E5EEB1D47E6A730.description: Demonstrate advanced understanding and skills in the use of the technology involved with the project.

1683A4BDC91648D9861051345A1CC721.description: Consistently apply effective project management processes throughout the project.

781B1B89FE384EE3862619F78A3B385B.description: Use a variety of applications, formats or media to present information or convey a message.

D24158D3D9184303955C0B61E3547D57.description: Establish a topic, theme or purpose (e.g., Truth and Reconciliation; love; to market a product) for the presentation.

0FCBA740F4BD457ABA614F8A7C3E1AE3.description: Develop an individual or group vision for a multimedia project that includes a variety of content formats such as text, audio, images, animations, video and interactive content.

B33480CC19C9419C9424F4CEA05805F1.description: Create a project around a common topic, theme or purpose using a variety of applications, formats or media.

99FE5FCFD0524926BE34F752810E9607.description: Reflect on the effectiveness of the project in achieving the desired purpose

E170E0CD8AEE4082ACB35D653680A9EC.description: Share the portfolio with others and solicit feedback.

5C26E4602C9E44088021A72B19938A6A.description: Assemble content into an appropriate digital presentation format (e.g., digital portfolio template tool, electronic book, video, website, multimedia presentation, portable document [PDF] file).

D8450BE6BD8247AF86F48AD7A5B12EE9.description: Include a variety of content formats (e.g., print documents, charts, graphics, photographs, videos) in the portfolio.

6DFEE3BBA30D4C31ABB51AE1045965BE.description: Showcase an interest, skill or accomplishment such as: technology (e.g., document production, data analysis, photography, video production, animation, website design); academics (e.g., language arts, social sciences, physical sciences, math); sports (e.g., school sports, community sports, personal activities); clubs (e.g., student council, Gay-Straight Alliance, Model United Nations, Students Against Drunk Driving);  arts (e.g., drawing, painting, music, dance); and, trades (e.g., welding, automotive, carpentry, agriculture)

5B6A0DB66BC54BE188A13187EF4E91C5.description: Present a consistent and appropriate style or personality (e.g., creative, professional, artistic, serious, fun) in the portfolio.

5D648AE76D2D4FDB85E1AAC6F183709E.description: Identify the purpose (e.g., application for employment or post-secondary education, archiving achievements, personal memories) of the portfolio.

604D92537D514C7A914133B887447A03.description: Demonstrate effective project management throughout the project.

77CAFB6E9C5844D182EC6CC8C872B944.description: Create an electronic portfolio that represents an area of interest.

581642B17C66412AB6BA4A9EF603356E.description: Incorporate previously investigated techniques into the production of one’s animation or stop-motion production

A93D1BB7A66C4B9FA180C8E1AFC22144.description: Plan a one to two-minute animation or stop-motion production using the project management process

1033EBEF718D4ADC8A8F8C8BD02889A6.description: Investigate the use of various transitions and animations within the software used.

A7734F27A20642DE885E494893F4BA79.description: Explore and experiment with the use of various camera angles (e.g., wide, medium, head shot) and camera movements in the creation of animation and stop-motion productions.

C68222E23F854C2DA530C674B67437AA.description: Investigate green screen techniques in conjunction with animation and stop-motion productions.

BBDF141727E3461F87C251613DEDED78.description: Analyze various animation styles and techniques including media used as the basis of the production.

E6A59AC8C80545118FB7B6822DD0A33B.description: Differentiate among cartooning, animation and stop-motion production.

567A8CB53CC549E9B3931AC5EFE8DFA4.description: Produce a short animation or stopmotion production.

688B66B91D1D42C6B1FA831AEF1AA83A.description: Create digital paintings demonstrating personal style, using digital tools and file formats.

1C8406F0F9CE43CDAB6EA8C86F7BCD4A.description: Create images representing different painting styles (e.g., abstract, landscape, still life, photorealism, impressionist, pop) using digital tools and file formats

419FA18D3C0E462EB4EB1D03FAA7D550.description: Experiment with a variety of painting techniques using a digital creation tool.

87DEA3C8B24B4A99A483A919F6D0A07B.description: Explore painting features (e.g., brush styles, thicknesses, colours, gradients) of a digital creation tool and apply to own work.

E9CECA42C91E47648569B354475AB179.description: Examine and note the characteristics of diverse painting styles of renowned painters from various cultures and periods of art history.

F44ABF3BBDB84170BFAAC1A89EADE699.description: Create digital paintings using digital tools.

7883462274644F0C80E7C527A76AF9C6.description: Create a story including pictorial representation of a cartoon character.

89F79D4FFB584BA2BCD1FAB28DCCC490.description: Develop a personality for a cartoon character incorporating motions, antics, habits, gestures and expressions.

6FE61DB8C8974E0A92D2E51347A8B828.description: Demonstrate motion in creation of a cartoon character, using a digital image editor.

504995A4ACB245E9B18F95E29C14187E.description: Create cartoon characters with varied body shapes, using various digital tools and file formats.

8EC1729FD8134997B008F4E3C18601B6.description: Analyze a variety of digital cartooning techniques used in the creation of characters, including body shapes and parts

42808F1B72E24B7B928AE8B2410117EF.description: Explore and practise cartooning techniques (e.g., head shape, body types, facial features, expression, exaggeration).

5434F1EA027142A0A935B24550BEE097.description: Compare cartoon culture in various parts of the world.

C358FD6262D144A2B4FCC4F3FEAC81E5.description: Investigate cartoons, comics, illustrations and graphic novels exhibiting various cartooning and caricaturing styles.

379FFE1A33FB4263B0FABB2D42B0462C.description: Generate digital graphic representations of cartoon characters.

3352A81E560349FA91C9BAB3B78B5065.description: Discuss the advantages and challenges of using a content management system when creating and maintaining a website.

A6AA70763F5E4B3AA30A439B4D23A649.description: Create meta tags to increase efficiency in searching a website

B812B7D56B834F8FAE47436AAA1DC482.description: Create and use forms such as a guest book or an email sign-up page to gather information.

48180E6D669840E8AA0D30AFB22CB5F0.description: Use HTML5 to embed video, audio and images with alternate text.

4838583A945B4D38B0054F101864A7D8.description: Insert and edit external scripts (e.g., applets, slide shows, mouse-overs).

9B6B52B6D26543F9B33BA6A6A591742D.description: Use CSS to improve accessibility (e.g., text to speech, page titles, heading levels) and create an engaging graphic layout.

F377CC8ADA764859BDBE3B7B777EF29A.description: Consider how to improve accessibility (e.g., visual, auditory, language, navigation) in a website

B221568372AB4651B96926F8C420BFF6.description: Use HTML or XML to make a structure for a website.

7652E0E667CF40AAB39B5CCD2E7D7216.description: Describe the role of JavaScript in making websites dynamic and interactive.

D4434580AFFD4E6DB31B9245136F35E7.description: Explore the use of server-side scripting languages such as Hypertext Preprocessor (PHP) or Python to develop websites

1667424CB95B4F75995D38D393E90746.description: Differentiate between HTML and XML, and describe the role of each in constructing websites.

A80908B67FD84A60913B59380870BBC9.description: Create a website that includes multiple elements (e.g., multiple pages, formatting), navigation (e.g., anchor links, hyperlinks), and content objects (e.g., pictures, sounds, video), and is responsive to scale with various display modes (e.g., tablet, mobile, desktop).

2400AD1161DE43E699F164CDDB5524DA.description: Develop a prototype visual design for a website, using engaging graphic layout with CSS.

1DD6235146F04FC1AA069C9B76447C7A.description: Apply the principles of digital responsibility to the creation of a website.

63E18A7A7C844EEEA6601D0C8B2CDD6D.description: Create an interactive website with an engaging graphic layout using hypertext markup language (HTML) or extensible markup language (XML), and cascading style sheets (CSS).

A303B9BF08A945A2AD9D65C9D042BE32.description: Reflect on the usefulness, accessibility and efficacy of the database.

B12AFD86451546B294E30E668CB953D3.description: Adjust parameters and organization of data to correct errors or solve problems in the database.

B04FCA43EB99491ABC0461A9D13739F5.description: Produce and modify reports (simple, grouped, summary and sub reports) following a stated layout and format.

46522BB4E9B645759BB2425F65CDC4B1.description: Create and use a variety of queries (e.g., complex queries, range queries, parameter queries, queries using fields and wildcards).

EB067A07CDFB4CAE9923BEA330650A61.description: Apply macros to automate processes in a database.

DBD98D43D2B84DB983F524BDA9225E4E.description: Automate loading and display of objects in a database.

B633F19B698C40F78C64794C04FBA943.description: Share data across applications: import data from a variety of sources and in a variety of formats; extract and use data from other applications in differing file formats; and, export data from a database to use in other applications (e.g., spreadsheets, word processing documents).

23360EDF17864551B621149FDF443623.description: Apply normalization by establishing relationships between tables in a database to eliminate redundancy and inconsistent dependency.

26C82000B73B4AC289D8B06DDDF76426.description: Locate, evaluate and select data to include in the database.

9CF4A7FD61694A4C9A4942A1F9DD9570.description: Create a database by establishing fields (e.g., text, numbers), creating tables, setting primary keys, and defining relationships between tables

D7DFAE93C8E548F4A44E4087C1E33A4A.description: Plan for the development of a relational database: determine the purpose of the database; consider the most effective organization of the database; anticipate the necessary data to include in the database; and, identify the end-user of the database

D6CA7019B9A64B558B02821E100DDCFA.description: Plan and create a relational database for use with other applications.

36AE59320A3E4CE583D20750FD8CC270.description: Incorporate multi-sheeted workbooks containing advanced functions into other software or applications.

0B719F8780B04FAA840A824004616B6F.description: Explore the use of macros in a spreadsheet and how they may be created using tools such as Visual Basic for Applications (VBA).

A9E043F5FA234224BA319169E717D562.description: Use pivot tables to summarize large amounts of data and pivot charts to display the data graphically.

40AFDED40E1E453DB77BBC73418E1C62.description: Research the features of and uses for pivot tables and charts

446F31B7C0884FCA9C0CC4C3E57C8421.description: Apply advanced functions such as CHOOSE, ROUND, COUNT, IF, AND OR, and FALSE to solve complex problems.

630379CAB6C149AEA36B6ED9AE14E680.description: Apply financial functions such as payment, future value of money, present value, rate and return to scenarios related to loans, credit cards, investments and other money management issues to a spreadsheet.

ED76448CE42E44A6AA269930EA421093.description: Use lookup tables to present information such as variable income tax rates, volume discounts offered by retailers and wholesalers, or shipping charges based on weight or quantity.

38FE59E11A3E41D5A32AEE9124CF8A3A.description: Use advanced functions to process information in multi-sheet workbooks (e.g., keep and analyze statistics for the basketball team; maintain financial records for a term loan).

FD4B5E2E1931413097AD221ED8E59EE5.description: Investigate how various advanced functions (e.g., SUMIF, SUMIFS, AverageIF, SUMPRODUCT) can be used to manipulate data.

E5EC103EEBDC438990641497620406C0.description: Apply conditional formatting to enable visual analysis of data in spreadsheets.

6AC78DD5D08744E39D23A2E3A9F2FE9A.description: Query and filter and sort data within a spreadsheet.

A9931D3CE17E418B9C79B468C21B465E.description: Link information from a spreadsheet to another application such as a word document.

828604FB32FC474A831FD851DC3D499B.description: Link information in one worksheet to another worksheet in the same workbook and from one workbook to another.

C3C62A773EBC439A8D46A14EF13429B8.description: Insert headers and footers that provide relevant information (e.g., date, file name or source, page number, document ownership).

C6BF5CA81DE9434EB78B4178C3D42377.description: Demonstrate reordering and renaming of sheet tabs within workbooks to match worksheet conventions.

1EF5F1D0F0904626932E134B33B9B3AD.description: Include components such as hyperlinks, graphics, graphs and sparklines to increase the efficacy of spreadsheets.

0B6BCA98ED6E4C0D9A755E5EDFA54501.description: Differentiate between the application of relative and absolute cell references in a spread sheet.

48D96CCD7F1A42BBBD06EEF900556D57.description: Explain circumstances in which a specific function (e.g., financial, logical, text, date and time, lookup and reference, math and trigonometry, statistical) might be used with a set of data.

3A39CDE006A94839ADDB6165E0A0705F.description: Create complex spreadsheets and workbooks that facilitate analysis and manipulation of specific data.

331AF65FCC734796BF738FFD27E4345B.description: Explore careers in the field of AI.

AC7C245DEB214435BA300CD34E82331C.description: Investigate a specific application of AI (e.g., spam filters): Describe the purpose of the AI application (e.g., to detect and prevent the delivery of unwanted email); Present or illustrate a specific example of the application (e.g., show the feature in one’s email inbox); Explain how the application is an example of AI (e.g., it learns from, and makes judgments based on, certain criteria); and, • Evaluate the effectiveness of the AI application (e.g., It reduces the amount of junk, but it might also filter important email).

4AD67D64DC954BB6BF95182B3D775E8D.description: Discuss the impact of specific AI applications on individuals or on societies (e.g., businesses receive less junk email because of spam filters, making communication more effective).

FC541BDF67264087A557EEC299BCA71E.description: Explain the ethical implications (e.g., racial profiling, choosing who lives or dies, unemployment, employment opportunities) of applications of AI

7DC0579F5D8A4DD9BFE1CCA516CCC985.description: Discuss the impact of AI on societal needs and desires such as personal assistance, transportation, research and exploration.

30B199CDCEEC4FA99A5A3778FF69FA65.description: Explore the factors of human intelligence and behaviour that cannot be replicated in AI (e.g., common sense, complex reasoning or intuition).

4633EBD288A84C1AA44E15AD239BEF59.description: Examine the extent to which AI can exceed or replace human ability in regards to certain tasks (e.g., game-playing computers, self-driving cars and personal assistants).

BE9FEE87C65A4197AF6D270012DAD9FB.description: Provide examples of current uses of AI (e.g., real-time language translation, voice to text features, chatbots, spam filters, virtual assistants, autonomous cars), and how they relate to communication

99CAF07C080A437990F8CEC5B4BF55E8.description: Analyze how devices with AI work differently than controlled or autonomous devices and robots.

48EAF1D2113B41C6BB256F05FD9EE131.description: Explain how to identify whether a robotic or automated device is considered to have AI.

FA4E36B48A244C7F95A18705829B85FD.description: Describe various types of artificial intelligence, including reactive machines, limited memory, theory of mind and self-awareness.

AD961A5F87F34DFCBC6129D3283CF50A.description: Investigate current and potential uses and applications of artificial intelligence.
